citations.narrative:
* There was no record of inventory observed on 27 unweaned puppies born at the facility. Complete and accurate records
are needed to ensure each animal's identity can be known with certainty and to facilitate the ability to trace all puppies.
The licensee shall make, keep, and maintain records or forms which fully and correctly disclose the following information
concerning each puppy. The records shall include any offspring born of any animal while in his or her possession or under
his or her control. Correct by 1/20/24.

No shade was observed in one outdoor enclosure housing six dogs at the time of inspection. The dogs were housed in a
large outdoor enclosure that had adequate shelter, but lacked trees or other shade structures that were separate from the
shelter. Outdoor facilities for dogs must contain one or more areas that provide shade and are separate from the shelter
structures. Lack of adequate shade can cause discomfort on warm days when dogs are acclimated to cold temperatures
and in the summer, months may lead to overheating. The licensee must ensure that shade (separate from shelter) is
provided for all dogs and is large enough to contain all the dogs at one time and protect them from the direct rays of the
sun. Correct by 1/3/24”.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.

narrative:
2.75(a)(1) 
   
Records: Dealers and exhibitors. 
* There was no record of inventory observed on 27 unweaned puppies born at the facility. Complete and accurate records 
are needed to ensure each animal's identity can be known with certainty and to facilitate the ability to trace all puppies. 
The licensee shall make, keep, and maintain records or forms which fully and correctly disclose the following information 
concerning each puppy. The records shall include any offspring born of any animal while in his or her possession or under 
his or her control. Correct by 1/20/24. 
3.4(b)(2) 
   
Outdoor housing facilities. 
No shade was observed in one outdoor enclosure housing six dogs at the time of inspection. The dogs were housed in a 
large outdoor enclosure that had adequate shelter, but lacked trees or other shade structures that were separate from the 
shelter. Outdoor facilities for dogs must contain one or more areas that provide shade and are separate from the shelter 
structures. Lack of adequate shade can cause discomfort on warm days when dogs are acclimated to cold temperatures 
and in the summer, months may lead to overheating. The licensee must ensure that shade (separate from shelter) is 
provided for all dogs and is large enough to contain all the dogs at one time and protect them from the direct rays of the 
sun. Correct by 1/3/24”. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
